page.title: 07Problem Of Footpaths.
page.content: There are a number of footpaths around the village of Little Harrowden and access to them has led to arguments between the County Ramblers Association and local farmers.This was the topic of a Regional television programme.Local farmers have ploughed up the fields across footpaths and planted crops. People wishing to use the footpaths have to walk waist high, through fields of oil seed rape and wheat.One rambler interviewed, claimed he had to dress up in full waterproof clothing in order to cross one particular field. Complaints were also made about ditches at the edge of fields across public footpaths which were difficult to negotiate. A local farmer who has planted such a crop has driven in wooden posts above the height of the crop to mark the route of the footpath.
